content.raw:
This seems really bizarre to me. What does it mean to divide a time value by another time value? In the best case scenario, it seems like it should produce a unitless ratio of durations (i.e. a scalar floating point value), not a new time value.

I guess this can't really be removed since it's already part of the public API, but we should consider deprecating it unless we have a compelling motivation or a meaningful concept behind it. Although we might want to consider deprecating all of the `Time` classes in favor of `std::chrono`.
